Class BurstlyScriptAdaptor

public final class BurstlyScriptAdaptor
extends Object
implements IBurstlyAdaptor, IClickTracker

Adaptor for Script support.

Author:
Alexey Redinskii

Method Detail

startTransaction

public void startTransaction(Map<String,?> paramsFromServer)
                      throws IllegalArgumentException
Description copied from interface: IBurstlyAdaptor
Ad processing entry point. This method is invoked at the beginning of a new ad transaction.
Method is executed in the main UI thread.

Specified by:
startTransaction in interface IBurstlyAdaptor
Parameters:
paramsFromServer - Map of parameters that came from ad server to configure ad showing logic
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - should be thrown if parameters are invalid and can not be processed correctly

getNewAd

public View getNewAd()
Description copied from interface: IBurstlyAdaptor
Requests a new ad. You should return view implementation and then using IBurstlyAdaptorListener.didLoad(String, boolean) or IBurstlyAdaptorListener.failedToLoad(String, boolean, String) callbacks notify platform about the result of calling for ad. If next ad will be an interstitial ad, this method should return null.
Important to notice that ad loading mechanism must be able to load ads when the returned view does not attached to layout or it is hidden. This is the "must have" condition for implementation. This method is executed in the main UI thread.

Specified by:
getNewAd in interface IBurstlyAdaptor
Returns:
View view that implements your ad

precacheAd

public View precacheAd()
Description copied from interface: IBurstlyAdaptor
Requests a new ad in precache mode. You should return view implementation and then using IBurstlyAdaptorListener.didLoad(String, boolean) or IBurstlyAdaptorListener.failedToLoad(String, boolean, String) callbacks notify Burstly sdk about the result of calling for new ad.
Important to notice that ad loading mechanism must be able to load ads when the returned view does not attached to layout or it is hidden. This is the "must have" condition for implementation. This method is executed in the main UI thread.

Specified by:
precacheAd in interface IBurstlyAdaptor
Returns:
View view that implements your precached ad

getNetworkName

public String getNetworkName()
Description copied from interface: IBurstlyAdaptor
Gets the network name.
For example: if your network is called MyNetwork you can use "mynetwork" as a networkName. This name is the same name used in Burstly system to configure your ad network.

Specified by:
getNetworkName in interface IBurstlyAdaptor
Returns:
String network name

supports

public boolean supports(String action)
Description copied from interface: IBurstlyAdaptor
Queries the adaptor for supported actions.
Currently supported actions are:
  • precacheInterstitial
Adaptor must correctly indicate if the action is supported for the parameters which are provided for this session. For example if your implementation does not support interstitial precaching you could implement this method like so:
 @Override
 public boolean supports(final String action) {
     return !(action.equals(AdaptorAction.PRECACHE_INTERSTITIAL.getCode()) && mIsInterstitial);
 }

Specified by:
supports in interface IBurstlyAdaptor
Parameters:
action - String action that is going to be executed
Returns:
boolean "true" means that the action can be executed safely, "false" means that the action should be skipped

getAdType

public IBurstlyAdaptor.BurstlyAdType getAdType()
Description copied from interface: IBurstlyAdaptor
Returns type of ad that will be displayed.
Supported ad types are:
  • IBurstlyAdaptor.BurstlyAdType.BANNER_AD_TYPE - return this type if banner ad will be loaded;
  • IBurstlyAdaptor.BurstlyAdType.INTERSTITIAL_AD_TYPE - return this type if an interstitial ad will be loaded;
  • IBurstlyAdaptor.BurstlyAdType.UNKNOWN_AD_TYPE - return this type if ad type is unknown. In this case we can not precache ad for this adaptor.
Example: 
 @Override
 public BurstlyAdType getAdType() {
     return mIsInterstitial ? BurstlyAdType.INTERSTITIAL_AD_TYPE : BurstlyAdType.BANNER_AD_TYPE;
 }

Specified by:
getAdType in interface IBurstlyAdaptor
Returns:
int type of ad. Currenty supported only IBurstlyAdaptor.BurstlyAdType.BANNER_AD_TYPE, IBurstlyAdaptor.BurstlyAdType.INTERSTITIAL_AD_TYPE, IBurstlyAdaptor.BurstlyAdType.UNKNOWN_AD_TYPE

startViewSession

public void startViewSession()
Description copied from interface: IBurstlyAdaptor
Fires before attaching adaptor view to Burslty layout. Adaptor view is visible after this method invocation and is attached to a view hierarchy.

Specified by:
startViewSession in interface IBurstlyAdaptor

endViewSession

public void endViewSession()
Description copied from interface: IBurstlyAdaptor
Fires before deattaching adaptor view from Burslty layout. Adaptor view is not visible after this method invocation and is deattached to a view hierarchy.

Specified by:
endViewSession in interface IBurstlyAdaptor

precacheInterstitialAd

public void precacheInterstitialAd()
Description copied from interface: IBurstlyAdaptor
Precache interstitial ad (including fullscreen video ads).You should return view implementation and then using IBurstlyAdaptorListener.didLoad(String, boolean) or IBurstlyAdaptorListener.failedToLoad(String, boolean, String) callbacks notify Burstly sdk about the result of the precaching.This method is executed in the main UI thread.

Specified by:
precacheInterstitialAd in interface IBurstlyAdaptor

showPrecachedInterstitialAd

public void showPrecachedInterstitialAd()
Description copied from interface: IBurstlyAdaptor
Shows previously precached interstitial ad. This is the place where standart lifecycle for the ad (if any) should be started.
This method is executed in the main UI thread.

Specified by:
showPrecachedInterstitialAd in interface IBurstlyAdaptor

endTransaction

public void endTransaction(IBurstlyAdaptor.TransactionCode endCode)
Description copied from interface: IBurstlyAdaptor
Last method of the ad processing lifecycle.
This method is executed in the main UI thread.

Specified by:
endTransaction in interface IBurstlyAdaptor
Parameters:
endCode - IBurstlyAdaptor.TransactionCode end code.
Codes are:
  • IBurstlyAdaptor.TransactionCode.CODE_SUCCESS
  • IBurstlyAdaptor.TransactionCode.CODE_FAILED
  • IBurstlyAdaptor.TransactionCode.CODE_CANCELLED
